definition: (coll.) foot of an animal or bird/(coll.) foot supporting a cooking pot etc
foot of a bird or animal/paw/claws/talons

sentences.english: I am the teeth in the darkness, the talons in the night.
sentences.chinese: 我是，黑暗的尖齒，深夜的魔爪。

sentences.english: The lost lamb can escape the clutches of the wolf?
sentences.chinese: 這頭迷途的羔羊能逃離狼的魔爪嗎？

sentences.english: Creativity is a temporary salvation from the claws of death.
sentences.chinese: 創造力是一種臨時的拯救，從死亡的魔爪中掙脫。

sentences.english: Thankfully, it now looks as if I’ll be spared.
sentences.chinese: 感謝上帝，看上去我現在已經暫時逃脫了魔爪。

sentences.english: Woman can't run away from talon of slimming forever.
sentences.chinese: 女性永遠難逃減肥的魔爪。

sentences.english: Lynx-Killer, Red Talons Galliard, howls softly.
sentences.chinese: 殺手林克斯，紅色魔爪歡舞者，溫柔地號叫。

sentences.english: We must take concerted action and cut his claws .
sentences.chinese: 我們必須齊心合力，斬斷他的魔爪。

definition: the power of sb or sth evil/the clutches (of a bad person etc)
to catch/to grapple with/to hold onto
to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
malign agent who manipulates from behind the scenes/hidden hand/(Tw) mechanic/blue-collar worker/manual laborer
variant of 厄運|厄运[e4 yun4]
to ravage/to devastate/to trample on/to violate
to rescue/to help out of difficulties/to save the situation
